tournament.name: Spotlight Series Utrecht - Main Event - Fanfinity

decks.notes: The deck focuses on utilizing the Underworld Breach combo to recur cards from the graveyard and generate infinite mana with Grinding Station and Emry's ability. Tamiyo and Emry provide card advantage and help to dig for combo pieces, while Haywire Mite can accelerate the combo. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Malevolent Rumble and Swan Song to protect the combo, as well as win conditions like Grapeshot and Jace, Wielder of Mysteries. Urza's Saga helps to find key artifacts like Grinding Station, while the mana base supports the deck's color requirements and provides utility lands for additional value.

This deck focuses on aggressive creatures that disrupt the opponent's plans. It utilizes cards like Dauthi Voidwalker and Relic of Progenitus to exile cards from the opponent's graveyard, preventing them from accessing key resources. The deck also includes powerful creatures like Ketramose, the New Dawn and Overlord of the Balemurk to pressure the opponent and end the game quickly. Flickerwisp and Ephemerate provide additional disruption by flickering creatures or spells. The deck also has removal options like Fatal Push and Thoughtseize to control the board and protect its own threats.

This deck revolves around quickly ramping up mana to cast Primeval Titan and combo off with lands like Urza's Saga and Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle. Arboreal Grazer and Amulet of Vigor help accelerate mana production, while cards like Cultivator Colossus and Dryad of the Ilysian Grove provide additional utility. By utilizing powerful lands and spells like Scapeshift, the deck can generate immense value and overwhelm opponents with large creatures and direct damage. The inclusion of cards like Summoner's Pact and Boseiju, Who Endures also help ensure the combo goes off smoothly.

The main concept of this Aggro - Hollow One deck is to rapidly deploy powerful creatures like Hollow One, Vengevine, and Detective's Phoenix to overwhelm the opponent quickly. Utilizing cards like Street Wraith and Burning Inquiry to trigger these creatures' abilities, combined with efficient self-discard options like Goblin Lore and Faithless Looting, allows for explosive starts and high pressure situations. Additionally, the inclusion of Marauding Mako and Flameblade Adept adds further aggression to the deck, while cards like Ox of Agonas and Fear of Missing Out provide additional value and flexibility in longer games.

The main theme of this Modern combo deck revolves around using Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student to generate mana and card advantage, while utilizing Grinding Station and Mishra's Bauble to mill through the deck quickly. The goal is to then loop powerful spells such as Malevolent Rumble and Grapeshot with Underworld Breach, combined with artifacts like Mox Opal and Urza's Saga, to create a lethal and repetitive win condition. The deck also includes control elements like Pithing Needle and removal spells to disrupt the opponent's game plan.

The main concept of this deck is to use the various creature and artifact cards to generate a powerful and unstoppable combo, taking advantage of effects like Blade of the Bloodchief, Agatha's Soul Cauldron, and Malevolent Rumble to overwhelm the opponent. With a mix of powerful creatures like Emrakul, the Promised End and efficient spell cards like Kozilek's Command, this deck aims to quickly establish board control and execute its game plan to secure victory. The lands and artifacts included in the deck provide additional support and versatility to ensure success in Modern 1 vs 1 matchups.

This aggro deck focuses on using the Death's Shadow ability to gain power while keeping opponents on the defensive. The deck includes a mix of disruption spells like Counterspell and Thoughtseize to control the board and clear the way for aggressive creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Murktide Regent. The deck also utilizes efficient removal spells like Fatal Push and Dismember to eliminate threats. By combining powerful creatures with disruptive spells, this deck aims to quickly overwhelm opponents and secure a victory.

The main concept of this deck is to ramp up quickly with Eldrazi Temple and Utopia Sprawl to cast powerful Eldrazi creatures like Emrakul, the Promised End and World Breaker. Control the board with spells like Devourer of Destiny and Malevolent Rumble to protect yourself until you can cast your big threats. Karn, the Great Creator can be used to shut down your opponent's artifacts, while Kozilek's Command and Kozilek's Return provide additional control options. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with big creatures and disruptive spells to secure victory.

The deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly through cards like Arboreal Grazer and Amulet of Vigor to bring out powerful threats like Primeval Titan and Cultivator Colossus. By utilizing lands like Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle and Vesuva, the deck aims to quickly assemble a combo that can deal massive amounts of damage to the opponent in a single turn. The deck also includes cards like Malevolent Rumble and Green Sun's Zenith for additional utility and ways to search for key pieces of the combo.

The deck revolves around using Underworld Breach to power through the graveyard, allowing for combo plays with Emry, Lurker of the Loch, Grinding Station, and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student. Mishra's Bauble and Mox Opal provide mana acceleration, while Urza's Saga helps tutor for key pieces. The goal is to assemble the combo pieces quickly and efficiently to generate infinite loops and win the game through card advantage and board control. The deck can also disrupt opponents with counterspells and removal spells, making it a versatile and powerful option in the Modern format.

The deck focuses on utilizing Underworld Breach and Grinding Station to create a loop that allows you to continuously mill yourself and potentially win the game with Thassa's Oracle. Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Mishra's Bauble help to fuel this combo by recurring artifacts from your graveyard. Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student helps with card draw and Mox Opal and Mox Amber provide mana acceleration. The rest of the deck is filled with control elements and protection spells to ensure you can successfully execute your combo.

The main focus of this Dimir Control deck is on disruption and removal. By using a combination of counterspells, discard spells, and removal cards, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan and control the board. The creatures in the deck also serve to provide additional disruption, whether through tapping down opposing creatures or bouncing them back to hand. The land base is optimized for consistent mana fixing to ensure the deck can play its spells efficiently. With this strategy, the deck looks to outlast the opponent and secure victory through attrition.

This Dimir Control deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan through a combination of hand disruption, counter spells, and removal spells. It also utilizes powerful creatures like Murktide Regent and Psychic Frog to apply pressure and close out the game. The deck aims to control the board and dominate the late game with its powerful spells and creatures, while limiting the opponent's ability to execute their own strategy. By efficiently handling threats and maintaining card advantage, this deck aims to outlast and outplay its opponents in a battle of attrition.

The main concept of this deck is to use ramp, control, and Eldrazi creatures to overwhelm the opponent. By using cards like Talisman of Impulse, Utopia Sprawl, and Eldrazi Temple, the deck can ramp quickly into powerful Eldrazi creatures like Emrakul, the Promised End and World Breaker. Control elements like Kozilek's Return and Karn, the Great Creator help manage the board and disrupt the opponent's game plan. The goal is to establish a dominant board presence and quickly close out the game with powerful Eldrazi threats.

This deck aims to aggressively control the opponent's hand and graveyard while rapidly reducing their life total. The key strategy involves using disruption spells like Inquisition of Kozilek and Thoughtseize to strip away the opponent's resources, while also utilizing removal spells like Fatal Push and Fell the Profane to maintain board control. The deck also features powerful finishers like Sheoldred, the Apocalypse and Soul Spike to quickly close out the game. Additionally, the deck includes cards like Relic of Progenitus and Necrodominance to disrupt graveyard strategies and maintain tempo.

The deck focuses on utilizing creatures with enter-the-battlefield or death triggers to combo off and generate value. The creatures in the deck provide toolbox options for different situations, allowing for flexibility and adaptability in gameplay. The deck also includes cards that facilitate searching for specific creatures and mana acceleration to quickly build a board presence. Overall, the deck aims to create synergies between its creatures and combo pieces to overwhelm the opponent and achieve victory through strategic play and resource management.

The deck focuses on deploying aggressive creatures quickly with the help of ramp spells to overwhelm the opponent. Using powerful creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer, and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury, along with burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Tribal Flames, the deck aims to deal damage quickly and efficiently. Leyline cards provide additional support by boosting the creatures' abilities and protecting them from removal. The mana base is carefully constructed to ensure consistent access to different colors of mana for casting spells efficiently.

This deck is focused on a fast aggressive playstyle, utilizing a combination of powerful creatures and burn spells to deal damage quickly and efficiently. It aims to overwhelm the opponent early on and maintain pressure throughout the game. The key strategy involves efficient mana management and utilizing synergy between creatures and spells to maximize damage output. The deck also includes cards that provide utility and disruption to control the board and protect its creatures. Overall, the deck aims to win the game as quickly as possible through a combination of creature aggression and burn damage.

The main focus of this Boros Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive playstyle. By using low cost creatures like Guide of Souls and Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer, along with powerful planeswalkers like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah, the deck aims to quickly build a board presence and deal damage efficiently. Supporting cards like Galvanic Discharge and Goblin Bombardment provide additional removal and reach, while Static Prison helps to control the opponent's board. The land base is optimized for consistency and mana fixing to ensure a smooth and aggressive gameplay.

The deck focuses on using Underworld Breach in combination with cards like Grinding Station and Emry, Lurker of the Loch to generate powerful combo plays. The goal is to quickly assemble the necessary pieces to create a loop of recurring cards from the graveyard, ultimately leading to a game-winning payoff like Grapeshot or Jace, Wielder of Mysteries. The deck also includes control elements like Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student and Lightning Bolt to disrupt the opponent's strategy while establishing your own win condition. The mana base includes lands like Urza's Saga and various fetch lands to ensure consistent and efficient mana production.

This deck focuses on utilizing Underworld Breach to create a powerful combo engine. By using Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student to loop through your graveyard, you can continuously cast spells from your graveyard, drawing cards, generating mana, and eventually winning the game with a storm finish using Grapeshot. The deck also incorporates artifacts like Mishra's Bauble and Mox Opal to enable fast mana production and card draw. Urza's Saga helps to tutor for key pieces, while interaction spells like Lightning Bolt and Swan Song provide protection and disruption against opponents.

The deck focuses on utilizing Underworld Breach to enable powerful combos with Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Grinding Station. It includes a variety of cheap artifacts and spells to help fuel the graveyard recursion and card advantage provided by Breach. The deck aims to streamline its way to victory through quickly assembling the necessary pieces to either mill the opponent out or win with Thassa's Oracle. It also includes disruptive elements like Swan Song and Malevolent Rumble to control the board while setting up its combo.

The deck focuses on utilizing Underworld Breach and Grinding Station to create a combo that allows for powerful graveyard recursion and milling capabilities. Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student are key pieces to help enable the combo, while Mishra's Bauble and Mox Opal assist in generating mana efficiency. The goal is to mill cards into the graveyard, activate Underworld Breach to cast spells from the graveyard, and eventually win the game through Thassa's Oracle or Jace, Wielder of Mysteries. The deck also includes disruption and card selection tools to support the combo strategy.

This deck focuses on using creatures with various abilities and sacrifice outlets to generate value and assemble combos. By utilizing cards like Viscera Seer and Chord of Calling, it can search for specific creatures like Yawgmoth, Thran Physician to create powerful synergies. The toolbox of creatures allows for flexible gameplay and the ability to adapt to different situations. The deck aims to outvalue opponents while setting up game-winning combinations that capitalize on sacrificing creatures for various effects. It emphasizes synergy and efficiency in executing its game plan.

This deck focuses on quickly disrupting your opponent's game plan by using a combination of aggressive creatures and disruptive spells. By utilizing cards like Thoughtseize and Fatal Push, you can control the board while deploying threats like Emperor of Bones and Recruiter of the Guard to apply pressure. Aether Vial allows you to cheat creatures into play quickly, while Ephemerate and Flickerwisp provide additional value by blinking your creatures. With a mix of removal, disruption, and efficient threats, this deck aims to overwhelm and outpace your opponent in a fast-paced game.

This deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan through a combination of counterspells, hand disruption, and removal spells. It aims to control the game by efficiently countering and removing threats while also generating card advantage with cards like Consider and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student. The deck also features powerful finishers like Murktide Regent and Kaito, Bane of Nightmares. By controlling the board and hand of the opponent, this deck seeks to outvalue and outlast the opponent in a long game.

This deck focuses on using ramp spells and mana acceleration to quickly cast powerful Eldrazi creatures like Emrakul and World Breaker. It also includes control elements like Kozilek's Return and Malevolent Rumble to disrupt opponents' strategies. Karn, the Great Creator is used to search for key artifacts like Ugin's Labyrinth to further control the game. The deck aims to overwhelm opponents with large creatures while controlling the board and disrupting their plans. It combines the ramp ability of Eldrazi with control elements to create a versatile and powerful strategy.

Utilize ramp spells and Eldrazi creatures to accelerate mana and control the game, eventually casting Emrakul, the Promised End. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy with removal and board wipes while building towards casting powerful Eldrazi creatures. Karn, the Great Creator provides additional utility and access to valuable artifacts. The combination of ramp, control elements, and powerful finishers allows the deck to overwhelm opponents with high-impact threats and disruption.

The deck focuses on utilizing ramp spells and mana acceleration to cheat out powerful Eldrazi creatures ahead of curve. It also includes control elements like sweepers and removal spells to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with large threats like Emrakul, the Promised End and World Breaker, while also having the flexibility to use Karn, the Great Creator for additional utility. The combination of ramping quickly into powerful threats and disrupting the opponent's strategy is the key concept of this Control - Eldrazi Ramp deck.

This Mardu Aggro deck focuses on maximizing aggression through a combination of efficient creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Overlord of the Balemurk, as well as removal spells such as Fatal Push and Prismatic Ending to clear the way for attacks. The deck also includes ways to disrupt opposing graveyard strategies with Relic of Progenitus, while utilizing powerful synergy with cards like Ephemerate and Witch Enchanter. The land base is carefully constructed to ensure consistent mana sources for the diverse card requirements. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents quickly and decisively.

The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's strategy while pushing for aggressive plays with a mix of creatures and removal spells. By combining powerful creatures like Ketramose and Overlord of the Balemurk with disruptive cards like Thoughtseize and Witch Enchanter, the deck aims to control the game while applying pressure to the opponent. With a versatile mix of aggression and disruption, the deck aims to outmaneuver opponents and come out on top in the 1 vs 1 format of Modern.

This deck focuses on using counterspells, removal, and control elements to disrupt the opponent's game plan while also utilizing card advantage with Snapcaster Mage and Jace, the Mind Sculptor. Murktide Regent and Thundering Falls provide threats to close out the game while Blood Moon and Flame of Anor disrupt the opponent's mana base. The deck aims to control the board and the opponent's resources, gradually taking over the game and securing victory through careful planning and efficient use of resources.

The concept of this deck is to utilize aggressive creatures and burn spells to quickly deal damage to the opponent. By combining powerful creatures like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury and Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer with efficient removal like Lightning Bolt and Tribal Flames, this deck aims to apply pressure early and often. The deck also includes Leyline of the Guildpact and Leyline Binding to help protect its creatures and maintain board control. With a focus on fast-paced gameplay and proactive strategies, this aggro deck aims to overwhelm opponents before they have a chance to stabilise.

This deck focuses on aggressive creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Territorial Kavu to quickly apply pressure on the opponent. Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury and Scion of Draco provide additional threats with powerful abilities. The deck also utilizes burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Tribal Flames to finish off the opponent. Leyline of the Guildpact and Leyline Binding help protect your creatures and disrupt your opponent's game plan. With a mix of creatures and spells, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and secure a swift victory.

This deck focuses on utilizing powerful creatures like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury and Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer to deal quick damage to the opponent. It relies on aggressive plays and efficient removal cards like Lightning Bolt to control the board and maintain pressure. The inclusion of Leyline of the Guildpact and Tribal Flames enhances the deck's ability to deal damage efficiently. Additionally, the mana base is carefully constructed to ensure consistent access to all colors needed for the spells in the deck.

This deck focuses on playing aggressive creatures and using burn spells to quickly deal damage to the opponent. It also utilizes Leyline cards to provide additional benefits and support for the creatures on the battlefield. The mana base is optimized for casting spells of multiple colors efficiently. The inclusion of Doorkeeper Thrull and Arena of Glory adds extra utility to the deck, providing ways to control the battlefield and gain advantages over the opponent. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with fast, efficient threats and burn spells to secure a quick victory.

This deck focuses on quickly deploying artifacts in order to generate a lot of mana and card advantage. It utilizes cards like Mishra's Bauble and Mox Opal to quickly ramp up and cast powerful threats like Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Thought Monitor. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Metallic Rebuke and Portable Hole to handle opposing threats. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of aggressive creatures and efficient spells, ultimately leading to victory through sheer board presence and card advantage.

The deck revolves around cheating out high-cost creatures like Allosaurus Rider and Autochthon Wurm by using Nourishing Shoal with another green creature. It also utilizes a variety of search cards like Summoner's Pact, Eladamri's Call, and Glittering Wish to find key pieces for the combo. The deck includes protection cards like Pact of Negation and Angel's Grace to ensure the combo goes off smoothly. Additionally, Eldritch Evolution and Neoform help tutor for specific creatures needed for the combo. With the right sequence of cards, the deck can quickly assemble its combo pieces for a game-winning play.

This deck aims to ramp up mana quickly, tutoring for key lands and combo pieces to eventually play powerful threats like Primeval Titan and Elesh Norn, Mother of Machines. Amulet of Vigor helps to accelerate the deck's game plan, while cards like Scapeshift and Summoner's Pact provide additional combo potential. Urza's Saga can also be used to find essential artifacts like Amulet of Vigor, creating a powerful engine that can overwhelm opponents. Overall, the deck looks to assemble its combo pieces efficiently and quickly to overwhelm opponents and secure a victory.

The deck focuses on quickly ramping up mana to play powerful lands and tutor for key combo pieces, ultimately winning the game with a massive Primeval Titan. By utilizing cards like Amulet of Vigor and Explore to generate additional land drops, the deck aims to assemble the Amulet Titan combo and overwhelm the opponent with a massive board state. Additionally, the deck includes various utility lands and spells to provide versatility and resilience against opposing strategies. The key strategy revolves around efficiently tutoring for and playing Primeval Titan to quickly close out the game.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on aggressive creature strategies, utilizing powerful creatures like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury and Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer to quickly overwhelm the opponent. The deck also includes support cards like Galvanic Discharge and Thraben Charm for removal and disruption, as well as powerful planeswalkers like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah for additional threats. The inclusion of cards like Static Prison and Arena of Glory help control the board and provide additional value. The deck aims to close out games quickly and efficiently through a combination of powerful creatures and versatile spells.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on aggressive creature plays and burn spells to quickly overwhelm opponents. The deck includes powerful creatures like Ragavan, Phlage, and Guide of Souls, along with supportive spells like Galvanic Discharge and Thraben Charm. The deck also includes disruption elements like Ranger-Captain of Eos and Static Prison to control the board and protect your creatures. With a mix of fast creatures and burn spells, this deck aims to apply pressure early and close out games before the opponent can stabilize and take control.

The deck focuses on aggressive, creature-heavy gameplay with a mixture of burn and disruption. It leverages the power of creatures like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury to quickly overwhelm opponents. It includes cards like Galvanic Discharge and Goblin Bombardment for direct damage, and Static Prison for control. The mana base allows for flexibility and enables early aggression. The deck aims to end the game quickly through a combination of creature attacks, burn spells, and disruption to disrupt the opponent's game plan.

This deck revolves around utilizing Underworld Breach to continuously cast spells from the graveyard, generating powerful combos that can quickly overwhelm the opponent. Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student help with card draw and finding key pieces, while Grinding Station and Mishra's Bauble provide additional synergy with the graveyard strategy. The inclusion of cards like Thassa's Oracle and Malevolent Rumble offer alternative win conditions, making the deck versatile and unpredictable. The goal is to assemble the pieces needed to execute a game-winning combo while controlling the board and disrupting the opponent's strategy.

The deck focuses on using Underworld Breach to repeatedly cast powerful spells from the graveyard, generating massive value and potentially winning the game in a single turn. The combination of artifacts like Mox Opal and Mishra's Bauble, along with combo pieces like Grinding Station and Urza's Saga, allows for explosive plays that can overwhelm opponents. Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student and Emry, Lurker of the Loch provide card advantage and filtering to find key pieces, while Karn, the Great Creator offers additional utility with his ability to shut down opposing artifacts.

The focus of this deck is to quickly assemble the combo pieces needed to utilize the Underworld Breach enchantment in conjunction with various artifacts to generate infinite mana and card advantage. Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student help to find and recur key pieces, while cards like Grinding Station and Mox Opal provide additional utility. The deck aims to win the game by casting Thassa's Oracle or overwhelming the opponent with Malevolent Rumble. The deck also includes disruption in the form of Lightning Bolt and Sink into Stupor to disrupt the opponent's game plan.

This deck focuses on utilizing the Underworld Breach combo to repeatedly cast spells from the graveyard and generate infinite mana or damage through Grinding Station and Malevolent Rumble. Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student and Emry, Lurker of the Loch provide card advantage and recursion, while cards like Mishra's Bauble and Mox Opal help to establish early game consistency. The deck also includes a variety of utility cards like Pithing Needle and Soul-Guide Lantern to disrupt opponent strategies. Overall, the deck aims to quickly assemble its combo pieces and overwhelm the opponent with its powerful synergy and resource management.

The deck focuses on utilizing the Underworld Breach enchantment to enable powerful combos with cards like Grinding Station and Malevolent Rumble. Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student help to dig for combo pieces while also providing additional value. The deck also includes various artifacts like Mishra's Bauble and Mox Opal to ramp up quickly and enable explosive plays. The inclusion of cards like Jace, Wielder of Mysteries and Karn, the Great Creator add additional win conditions and utility to the deck, making it a versatile and dangerous combo archetype in Modern 1 vs 1 format.

The deck focuses on utilizing Underworld Breach and Grinding Station to create a looping combo that allows for repeated mill and value generation. Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student help to dig for combo pieces and provide additional utility. The deck includes a mix of artifacts and spells to support the combo, with cards like Mishra's Bauble and Malevolent Rumble adding consistency and disruption. The goal is to quickly assemble the combo pieces and win the game through milling the opponent or through alternate win conditions like Thassa's Oracle.

The deck focuses on utilizing the Underworld Breach combo to continuously loop powerful cards from the graveyard, while also using artifacts to generate mana and draw cards. Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student help with card selection and recursion, while Grinding Station and Mishra's Bauble provide additional value. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a strong value engine and eventually win through either decking them out or using Grapeshot to deal lethal damage.

The main idea of the deck is to use cards like Basking Broodscale and Glaring Fleshraker to generate a strong board presence, while utilizing cards like Kozilek's Command and Malevolent Rumble to control the field and disrupt the opponent's strategy. The deck also includes ways to search for key combo pieces like Blade of the Bloodchief and Urza's Saga. Emrakul, the Promised End serves as a powerful win condition, and the deck includes support cards like Agatha's Soul Cauldron and Soul-Guide Lantern to further enhance its strategy.

The main deck of this Modern 1 vs 1 Aggro - Red Deck Wins archetype focuses on quickly dealing damage to the opponent through low-cost creatures and burn spells. Key cards like Goblin Guide, Monastery Swiftspear, Lightning Bolt, and Eidolon of the Great Revel are used to pressure the opponent early on. The deck aims to efficiently use cards like Boros Charm, Searing Blaze, Lava Spike, and Bump in the Night to maintain tempo and win the game before the opponent can stabilize. Lands like Arid Mesa and Sunbaked Canyon help ensure consistent mana sources for the aggressive gameplay.

This deck utilizes a variety of creatures with different abilities to create a toolbox approach, allowing for flexibility and adaptability in different matchups. By sacrificing creatures like Cauldron Familiar and Young Wolf to Viscera Seer or Yawgmoth, Thran Physician, the deck can generate value and control the board. The inclusion of cards like Chord of Calling and Birthing Ritual help search for specific creatures or ramp into larger threats. Overall, the deck aims to assemble key pieces to create powerful synergies and outvalue the opponent in the late game.

The deck focuses on using a combination of creatures and spells to create a toolbox of options for different situations. By utilizing cards like Gilded Goose, Cauldron Familiar, and Viscera Seer to generate resources and manipulate the board state, the deck can pull off powerful combos with cards like Chord of Calling and Birthing Ritual. The inclusion of creatures like Yawgmoth, Thran Physician and Fiend Artisan allows for flexibility and adaptability in responding to various threats. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver opponents through its diverse range of options.

The main concept of this deck is to capitalize on the aggressive nature of Death and Taxes archetype by combining powerful creatures with disruptive elements. By utilizing cards like Aether Vial, Solitude, and Ephemerate, the deck aims to control the opponent's board while establishing a strong board presence of its own. Recruiter of the Guard is included to tutor for key creatures, while cards like Thoughtseize and Fatal Push provide additional disruption. The deck's combination of aggressive creatures and disruption makes it a formidable force in the Modern 1 vs 1 format.

The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's strategy by utilizing a combination of hand disruption spells and removal cards. It also aims to control the board with efficient creatures and powerful enchantments. The inclusion of Mishra's Bauble allows for additional card advantage, while Emperor of Bones and Psychic Frog provide value through their abilities. The land base is designed to support the deck's strategy by ensuring consistent mana access and synergy with key cards like Urza's Saga. Overall, the deck excels at maintaining control over the game while gradually building towards a win condition.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game by ramping up Eldrazi creatures onto the battlefield quickly. This is done through cards like Talisman of Impulse and Utopia Sprawl to accelerate mana production, while also having control elements such as Kozilek's Command and Malevolent Rumble to disrupt the opponent's strategy. Emrakul, the Promised End serves as a powerful finisher, while Karn, the Great Creator can provide additional utility and access to key artifacts. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with powerful creatures and versatile control options.

The main concept of this deck is to ramp up mana quickly using Eldrazi Temple and Utopia Sprawl, while controlling the board with cards like Kozilek's Return and Malevolent Rumble. The deck then aims to play powerful Eldrazi creatures like Emrakul, the Promised End and World Breaker to dominate the late game. Karn, the Great Creator is included to provide additional utility and disruption. Overall, the strategy revolves around using Eldrazi creatures to quickly overwhelm the opponent while maintaining control of the game.

The deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly through Utopia Sprawl and Talisman of Impulse to cast powerful Eldrazi creatures such as Emrakul, the Promised End and World Breaker. It also utilizes control elements like Kozilek's Return and Karn, the Great Creator to disrupt opponents' strategies. Sowing Mycospawn and Nulldrifter provide card advantage and help with board presence. Malevolent Rumble serves as a board wipe while Devourer of Destiny offers a resilient threat. The deck aims to overwhelm opponents with huge creatures and controlling the battlefield to secure victory.

The deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly to cast powerful Eldrazi creatures such as Emrakul and Sire of Seven Deaths. It also utilizes control elements like Kozilek's Command and Malevolent Rumble to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with big threats while controlling the board with removal spells. Additionally, Karn, the Great Creator provides utility and additional threats, making it a versatile and powerful control deck with the ability to quickly close out games with powerful Eldrazi creatures.

This Mardu Aggro deck focuses on aggressive strategies, utilizing powerful creatures and efficient removal spells to quickly overwhelm opponents. The deck includes versatile threats like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Ajani, Nacatl Pariah, along with disruptive cards like Prismatic Ending and Static Prison to control the board. The inclusion of cards like Goblin Bombardment and Fable of the Mirror-Breaker provide additional reach and resilience, while Relic of Progenitus helps to disrupt graveyard-based strategies. The mana base is carefully constructed to support the aggressive game plan while ensuring consistent and powerful plays.

The main concept of this Mono Black Aggro deck is to aggressively control the board with removal spells like Fatal Push and Thoughtseize, while also utilizing graveyard manipulation with cards like Necrodominance and Soul Spike. The deck also focuses on disrupting the opponent's hand and gaining card advantage through cards like Inquisition of Kozilek and Profane Tutor. Additionally, the deck has a strong finisher in Sheoldred, the Apocalypse, and utilizes creatures like Boggart Trawler and Dauthi Voidwalker to apply pressure on the opponent. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of aggro threats and disruptive spells.

This deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's hand and graveyard while efficiently removing threats on the board. By using cards like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek to strip the opponent's hand, along with cards like Fatal Push and Pest Control to deal with creatures, the deck aims to control the game early on. Additionally, utilizing cards like Soul Spike and Fell the Profane as finishers, along with powerful creatures like Sheoldred, the Apocalypse and Ketramose, the New Dawn, the deck looks to close out the game quickly and decisively.

The deck focuses on utilizing cheap and efficient burn spells to deal direct damage to the opponent while also utilizing aggressive low-cost creatures to pressure the opponent's life total quickly. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and relentless onslaught of damage, utilizing cards like Goblin Guide and Monastery Swiftspear to chip away at their life total while finishing them off with powerful burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Lava Spike. The deck aims to end the game quickly before the opponent has a chance to stabilize or mount a defense.
